events: 24 Hour Events:, TRANSTHORACIC ECHO - At [**2151-10-25**] 08:00 AM,   Left ventricular cavity enlargement with inferior/inferolateral and,   apical aneurysms with probable mural thrombus in the inferior aneurysm.,   Moderate mitral regurgitation. LVEF 25-30%, CARDIAC CATH - At [**2151-10-25**] 08:45 AM:   severe 3vd: RCA occluded,,   LAD 80-90% prox 70% D1, Cx 80-90% at origin. Also had elevated left and,   right sided filling pressures with an RVEDP of 14 mmHg and a mean PCWP,   of 20 mmHg.,   There was moderate pulmonary arterial systolic hypertension with a PASP,   of 48 mmHg. The cardiac index was preserved at 2.4 L/min/m2.,   Evaluated by CT surgery, being pre-opt for CABG.  Calcified inferior,   wall LV aneurysm not in good location for aneurysm-ectomy.,   Will need rest redistribution thallium viability study. D/C'd Plavix.,   Post cath check ok.,   .,   Hemoptysis in the afternoon - post nasal drip of blood then coughing it,   up as well as clot from R nostril.  Pulm consulted.  We kept him on,   heparin because we felt the bleeding was most likely epistaxis and he,   does have LV aneurysm with probably mural thrombus.,   .,   CXR wet read showed pulm edema with underlying emphysema.,   .,   CT chest wet read showed probably mild pulmonary edema superimposed on,   emphysema which severe in lung apices, with small Lt>Rt pleural,   effusions. no mediastinal hematoma seen. aortic, coronary, aortic,   valvular calcifications. calcified presumed left ventricular aneurysm.,   no pericardial effusion. 10 x 12 x 18 mm ovoid high density (182 [**Doctor Last Name **]) in,   distal esophagus of uncertain etiology; possibly foreign,   body/tablet? -- recommend correlate with history and if not resolved,,   could consider EGD,   .,   This AM reports feeling well.  Denies any CP, SOB, dizziness.,   Continues to have small volume hemoptysis and is now anxious about,   pathology in the lungs.,   Tele: NSR with frequent ectopy,
